message_1:
What is the residue of the function f(z) = (z^3 - 1)/(z - i) at z = i?

Solution: 

The function f(z) has a simple pole at z = i. To find the residue at z = i, we can use the formula:

Res[f(z), z=i] = lim_{z -> i} (z - i) f(z)

= lim_{z -> i} (z - i) [(z^3 - 1)/(z - i)]

= lim_{z -> i} [(z + i)(z^2 + iz - 1)]

= i(2i - 1)

= -1 + 2i 

Therefore, the residue of f(z) at z = i is -1 + 2i.

It seems that the same question has been asked multiple times, and the answer remains the same:

The residue of the function f(z) = (z^3 - 1)/(z - i) at z = i is -1 + 2i.
